title: Registry Run Keys  and  Startup Folder
descrption: Adding an entry to the "run keys" in the Registry or startup folder will cause the program referenced to be executed when a user logs in. [1] These programs will be executed under the context of the user and will have the account's associated permissions level.The following run keys are created by default on Windows systems: HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\RunOnce HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\RunOnceThe HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\RunOnceEx is also available but is not created by default on Windows Vista and newer. Registry run key entries can reference programs directly or list them as a dependency. [2] For example, it is possible to load a DLL at logon using a "Depend" key with RunOnceEx: reg add HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\RunOnceEx\0001\Depend /v 1 /d "C:\temp\evil[.]dll" [3]The following Registry keys can be used to set startup folder items for persistence: HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Explorer\User Shell Folders HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Explorer\Shell Folders HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Explorer\Shell Folders HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Explorer\User Shell FoldersThe following Registry keys can control automatic startup of services during boot: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\RunServicesOnce HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\RunServicesOnce HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\RunServices HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\RunServicesUsing policy settings to specify startup programs creates corresponding values in either of two Registry keys: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\Explorer\Run HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\Explorer\RunThe Winlogon key controls actions that occur when a user logs on to a computer running Windows 7. Most of these actions are under the control of the operating system, but you can also add custom actions here. The HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Winlogon\Userinit and HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Winlogon\Shell subkeys can automatically launch programs.Programs listed in the load value of the registry key HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Windows run when any user logs on.By default, the multistring BootExecute value of the registry key HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\System\CurrentControlSet\Control\Session Manager is set to autocheck autochk *. This value causes Windows, at startup, to check the file-system integrity of the hard disks if the system has been shut down abnormally. Adversaries can add other programs or processes to this registry value which will automatically launch at boot.Adversaries can use these configuration locations to execute malware, such as remote access tools, to maintain persistence through system reboots. Adversaries may also use Masquerading to make the Registry entries look as if they are associated with legitimate programs.
System Requirements: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE keys require administrator access to create and modify

related.Name: ADVSTORESHELL
related.Description: ADVSTORESHELL achieves persistence by adding itself to the HKCU\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run Registry key.[55][56][57]

related.Name: Agent Tesla
related.Description: Agent Tesla adds itself to the Registry as a startup program to establish persistence.[76]

related.Name: APT18
related.Description: APT18 establishes persistence via the HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run key.[139][140]

related.Name: APT19
related.Description: An APT19 HTTP malware variant establishes persistence by setting the Registry key HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run\Windows Debug Tools-%LOCALAPPDATA%\.[127]

related.Name: APT29
related.Description: APT29 added Registry Run keys to establish persistence.[115]

related.Name: APT3
related.Description: APT3 places scripts in the startup folder for persistence.[146]

related.Name: APT32
related.Description: APT32 established persistence using Registry Run keys, both to execute PowerShell and VBS scripts as well as to execute their backdoor directly.[143][144][145]

related.Name: APT33
related.Description: APT33 has deployed a tool known as DarkComet to the Startup folder of a victim.[152]

related.Name: APT37
related.Description: APT37's has added persistence via the Registry key HKCU\Software\Microsoft\CurrentVersion\Run\.[119][120]

related.Name: APT39
related.Description: APT39 has maintained persistence using the startup folder.[151]

related.Name: APT41
related.Description: APT41 created and modified startup files for persistence. [155]

related.Name: Astaroth
related.Description: Astaroth creates a startup item for persistence.[101]

related.Name: BabyShark
related.Description: BabyShark has added a Registry key to ensure all future macros are enabled for Microsoft Word and Excel as well as for additional persistence.[113]

related.Name: Backdoor.Oldrea
related.Description: Backdoor.Oldrea adds Registry Run keys to achieve persistence.[18]

related.Name: BACKSPACE
related.Description: BACKSPACE achieves persistence by creating a shortcut to itself in the CSIDL_STARTUP directory.[37]

related.Name: BADNEWS
related.Description: BADNEWS installs a registry Run key to establish persistence.[46]

related.Name: BadPatch
related.Description: BadPatch establishes a foothold by adding a link to the malware executable in the startup folder.[67]

related.Name: BBSRAT
related.Description: BBSRAT has been loaded through DLL side-loading of a legitimate Citrix executable that is set to persist through the Registry Run key location HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run\ssonsvr.exe.

related.Name: Bisonal
related.Description: Bisonal adds itself to the Registry key HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\CurrentVersion\Run\ for persistence.[91]

related.Name: BlackEnergy
related.Description: The BlackEnergy 3 variant drops its main DLL component and then creates a .lnk shortcut to that file in the startup folder.[16]

related.Name: Briba
related.Description: Briba creates run key Registry entries pointing to malicious DLLs dropped to disk.[9]

related.Name: BRONZE BUTLER
related.Description: BRONZE BUTLER has used a batch script that adds a Registry Run key to establish malware persistence.[133]

related.Name: Carbanak
related.Description: Carbanak stores a configuration files in the startup directory to automatically execute commands in order to persist across reboots.[36]

related.Name: Cardinal RAT
related.Description: Cardinal RAT establishes Persistence by setting the  HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Windows\Load Registry key to point to its executable.[26]

related.Name: ChChes
related.Description: ChChes establishes persistence by adding a Registry Run key.[42]

related.Name: Cobalt Group
related.Description: Cobalt Group has used Registry Run keys for persistence. The group has also set a Startup path to launch the PowerShell shell command and download Cobalt Strike.[134]

related.Name: Cobian RAT
related.Description: Cobian RAT creates an autostart Registry key to ensure persistence.[85]

related.Name: Comnie
related.Description: Comnie achieves persistence by adding a shortcut of itself to the startup path in the Registry.[15]

related.Name: CORESHELL
related.Description: CORESHELL has established persistence by creating autostart extensibility point (ASEP) Registry entries in the Run key and other Registry keys, as well as by creating shortcuts in the Internet Explorer Quick Start folder.[35]

related.Name: CozyCar
related.Description: One persistence mechanism used by CozyCar is to set itself to be executed at system startup by adding a Registry value under one of the following Registry keys: HKLM\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run\ HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run\ HKLM\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\Explorer\Run HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\Explorer\Run[43]

related.Name: CrossRAT
related.Description: CrossRAT uses run keys for persistence on Windows

related.Name: Dark Caracal
related.Description: Dark Caracal's version of Bandook adds a registry key to HKEY_USERS\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run for persistence.[132]

related.Name: DarkComet
related.Description: DarkComet adds several Registry entries to enable automatic execution at every system startup.[50][51]

related.Name: Darkhotel
related.Description: Darkhotel has been known to establish persistence by adding programs to the Run Registry key.[148]

related.Name: DownPaper
related.Description: DownPaper uses PowerShell to add a Registry Run key in order to establish persistence.[17]

related.Name: Dragonfly 2.0
related.Description: Dragonfly 2.0 added the registry value ntdll to the Registry Run key to establish persistence.[142]

related.Name: DustySky
related.Description: DustySky achieves persistence by creating a Registry entry in HKCU\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run.[31]

related.Name: Elise
related.Description: If establishing persistence by installation as a new service fails, one variant of Elise establishes persistence for the created .exe file by setting the following Registry key: HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run\svchost : %APPDATA%\Microsoft\Network\svchost.exe. Other variants have set the following Registry keys for persistence: HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run\imejp : [self] and HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run\IAStorD.[10][11]

related.Name: Emissary
related.Description: Variants of Emissary have added Run Registry keys to establish persistence.[38]

related.Name: Emotet
related.Description: Emotet has been observed adding the downloaded payload to the HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run key to maintain persistence.[97][98][99]

related.Name: Empire
related.Description: Empire can modify the registry run keys HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run and HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run for persistence.[8]

related.Name: EvilBunny
related.Description: EvilBunny has created Registry keys for persistence in [HKLM|HKCU]\…\CurrentVersion\Run.    [111]

related.Name: EvilGrab
related.Description: EvilGrab adds a Registry Run key for ctfmon.exe to establish persistence.[42]

related.Name: FELIXROOT
related.Description: FELIXROOT adds a shortcut file to the startup folder for persistence.[63]

related.Name: FIN10
related.Description: FIN10 has established persistence by using the Registry option in PowerShell Empire to add a Run key.[130][8]

related.Name: FIN6
related.Description: FIN6 has used Registry Run keys to establish persistence for its downloader tools known as HARDTACK and SHIPBREAD.[131]

related.Name: FIN7
related.Description: FIN7 malware has created Registry Run and RunOnce keys to establish persistence, and has also added items to the Startup folder.[149][150]

related.Name: Final1stspy
related.Description: Final1stspy creates a Registry Run key to establish persistence.[27]

related.Name: FinFisher
related.Description: FinFisher establishes persistence by creating the Registry key HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\Run.[87][88]

related.Name: FLASHFLOOD
related.Description: FLASHFLOOD achieves persistence by making an entry in the Registry's Run key.[37]

related.Name: Gazer
related.Description: Gazer can establish persistence by creating a .lnk file in the Start menu.[19][20]

related.Name: gh0st RAT
related.Description: gh0st RAT adds a Registry Run key to establish persistence.[81]

related.Name: Gold Dragon
related.Description: Gold Dragon establishes persistence in the Startup folder.[40]

related.Name: Gorgon Group
related.Description: Gorgon Group malware can create a .lnk file and add a Registry Run key to establish persistence.[147]

related.Name: GRIFFON
related.Description: GRIFFON has used a persistence module that stores the implant inside the Registry, which executes at logon.[114]

related.Name: Helminth
related.Description: Helminth establishes persistence by creating a shortcut in the Start Menu folder.[52]

related.Name: Hi-Zor
related.Description: Hi-Zor creates a Registry Run key to establish persistence.[72]

related.Name: Honeybee
related.Description: Honeybee uses a batch file that configures the ComSysApp service to autostart in order to establish persistence.[136]

related.Name: HTTPBrowser
related.Description: HTTPBrowser has established persistence by setting the HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run key value for wdm to the path of the executable. It has also used the Registry entry HKEY_USERS\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run vpdn "%ALLUSERPROFILE%\%APPDATA%\vpdn\VPDN_LU.exe" to establish persistence.[47][48]

related.Name: InnaputRAT
related.Description: Some InnaputRAT variants establish persistence by modifying the Registry key HKU\\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run:%appdata%\NeutralApp\NeutralApp.exe.[49]

related.Name: Ixeshe
related.Description: Ixeshe can achieve persistence by adding itself to the HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run Registry key.[109]

related.Name: JCry
related.Description: JCry has created payloads in the Startup directory to maintain persistence.[110]

related.Name: JHUHUGIT
related.Description: JHUHUGIT has used a Registry Run key to establish persistence by executing JavaScript code within the rundll32.exe process.[22]

related.Name: Kasidet
related.Description: Kasidet creates a Registry Run key to establish persistence.[89][90]

related.Name: Kazuar
related.Description: Kazuar adds a sub-key under several Registry run keys.[59]

related.Name: Ke3chang
related.Description: Several Ke3chang backdoors achieved persistence by adding a Run key.[135]

related.Name: Kimsuky
related.Description: Kimsuky has placed scripts in the startup folder for persistence.[153]

related.Name: KONNI
related.Description: A version of KONNI drops a Windows shortcut into the Startup folder to establish persistence.[66]

related.Name: Lazarus Group
related.Description: Lazarus Group malware attempts to maintain persistence by saving itself in the Start menu folder or by adding a Registry Run key.[121][122][123]

related.Name: Leviathan
related.Description: Leviathan has used JavaScript to create a shortcut file in the Startup folder that points to its main backdoor.[125][126]

related.Name: LoJax
related.Description: LoJax has modified the Registry key ‘HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\Session Manager\BootExecute’ from ‘autocheck autochk ’ to ‘autocheck autoche
